Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of dancing figures (left arm of figure on left and right arm and part of body, with added red, of figure on right remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.195.1894.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 265, no. B192) (incorrectly stated as pl. XX, no.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1053)
